item.title: Syria Looks to Pick Up the Pieces of Its Shattered Economy
item.description: The country’s inexperienced leaders are trying to figure out how to revive an economy decimated by sanctions and years of conflict.

item.title: South Korean Plane Crash Kills 179 in One of Deadliest Aviation Disasters in Years
item.description: The flight, operated by Jeju Air, had departed from Bangkok with 175 passengers and six crew members aboard.

item.title: Azerbaijan Accuses Russia of Coverup in Kazakhstan Plane Crash
item.description: Azeri President Ilham Aliyev says Vladimir Putin’s apology isn’t enough, in a confrontation that shows Moscow’s waning influence over former Soviet territories.

item.title: Jimmy Carter, Former U.S. President and Nobel Peace Prize Winner, Dies at 100
item.description: His single term in the White House was marked by the Iran hostage crisis and economic problems but was followed by decades of humanitarian work and the Nobel Peace Prize.

item.title: Remembrances: Those Who Died in 2024
item.description: From Alexei Navalny to Quincy Jones, a look at notable deaths in The Wall Street Journal during the year.

item.title: Haitians Flee Gangs on a Mountain Trail 'Where Even the Dogs Don't Go'
item.description: Urban warfare drives tens of thousands of Haitians out of Port-au-Prince along one of the last remaining escape routes, a rugged cliff-side footpath.

item.title: China Has Limited Firepower to Counter U.S. Tariffs
item.description: While Beijing has already brandished the ways it could hit back at Trump‘s levies, such retaliation risks boomeranging.

item.title: The Elusive Crime Boss Linked to Billion-Dollar 'Pig Butchering' Scams
item.description: The Chinese mobster known as Broken Tooth has played a central role in the emergence of a virulent new form of cyber fraud.

item.title: Charles Dolan, Cable-TV Pioneer Behind HBO and AMC, Dies at 98
item.description: The Cablevision founder’s holdings stretched from local TV systems to Madison Square Garden.

item.title: Epic Construction Site in the Saudi Desert Is a Hazard for Workers
item.description: Gang rape, suicides and highway deaths plague Neom, the futuristic vision of Crown Prince Mohammed.

item.title: Putin Apologizes Over 'Tragic Incident' Involving Crashed Plane
item.description: The Russian leader’s phone call to Azerbaijan’s president stopped short of acknowledging responsibility for the crash of an Azerbaijan Airlines plane that killed 38.

item.title: The Progressive Moment in Global Politics Is Over
item.description: Weak economic growth and record immigration are driving gains by the right, especially populists—and the trend is set to continue.

item.title: For Survivors of a Ravaged Kibbutz, the Journey Home Is Only Just Beginning
item.description: Torn between a traumatic past and trying to build a future, the Kibbutz Be’eri community is debating how best to move forward.

item.title: Azerbaijan Airlines Says Deadly Crash Caused by 'External Interference'
item.description: The statement is the closest officials have come to confirming mounting suspicions that the plane was downed by a Russian air-defense system.

item.title: Iran Detains Prominent Italian Journalist Cecilia Sala
item.description: The arrest comes as regimes increasingly resort to seizing Westerners for leverage.

item.title: Driver in China Car-Ramming Attack Sentenced to Death
item.description: An incident that left 35 people dead drew condemnation from leader Xi Jinping and spurred efforts to tamp down unrest.

item.title: Osamu Suzuki, Small-Car Wizard Who Built India's Dominant Automaker, Dies at 94
item.description: Suzuki led the car and motorcycle maker that bears his name for more than four decades and was always looking for niches.

item.title: Missiles Are Now the Biggest Killer of Airline Passengers
item.description: This week’s crash in Kazakhstan, if confirmed as a shootdown, would be the third such major incident since 2014.

item.title: Mexico Worries Trump Will Order U.S. Strikes Against Drug Cartels
item.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum is fighting organized crime to blunt criticism from the incoming U.S. administration.

item.title: South Korea Impeaches Acting President, Prolonging Political Upheaval
item.description: Han Duck-soo declined to make judicial appointments needed to advance the impeachment of his predecessor.
